intro: Pleroma setosociliatum, commonly known as the hairy-ciliate pleroma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and ciliate (fringed) leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Native to parts of Central and South America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
